snippet: The legislation, which had reopened a searing debate, allows regions to grant official status to Russian and other languages spoken by at least 10 percent of their population.
abstract: Ukrainian Parliament, acting unexpectedly, approves a bill reaffirming Ukrainian as the country's sole national language; legislation has spawned protests and reopened a debate in the country, a former Soviet republic where millions of people speak Russian as their native tongue.
lead_paragraph: The legislation, which had reopened a searing debate, allows regions to grant official status to Russian and other languages spoken by at least 10 percent of their population.

headline.main: Lawmakers in Ukraine Approve Bill on Language
headline.print_headline: Lawmakers In Ukraine Approve Bill On Language
